Name: Women in Tech
Description: A non profit organization that promotes women in tech.

Name: Lesbians Who Tech
Description: Supports queer women in and around tech.

Name: Tech LadyMafia
Description: Tech LadyMafia supports women who work in and around the internet. We are astrophysicists and developers, writers and digital strategists.

Name: MotherCoders
Description: A tech orientation program designed for women with kids.

Name: Skillcrush
Description: Skillcrush is an interactive online learning community for creatives, thinkers, and makers.

Name: Black Girls Code
Description: A non-profit organization teaching women of color to code.

Name: Girl Develop It
Description: Girl Develop It is a nonprofit organization that exists to provide affordable and judgment-free opportunities for women interested in learning web and software development.

Name: Pipeline Fellowship
Description: Organization changing the face of angel investing and creating capital for women social entrepreneurs.

Name: Articulate Network
Description: Articulate aims to raise the profile of women speakers in the technology and the creative industries by offering public speaking training, developing partnerships with event programmers, and giving better access to talented female speakers.

Name: Black Female Coders
Description: Supports women of color in tech.

Name: Latinas in Computing
Description: A community created by and for Latinas in computing fields with a mission of promoting their representation and success.

Name: NY Tech Women
Description: Not-for-profit feminist videogame arts organization. For and by women/nb/queer folks who make + change games. Community, events, space to work, play + exhibit.

Name: Dames Making Games
Description: Supporting dames interested in making, playing, and changing games.

Name: Berlin Geekettes
Description: a community of women dedicated to helping aspiring and established female tech innovators.

Name: Canadian Women in Communications and Technology
Description: Canadian national organization dedicated to the advancement of women through a coast to coast network of professional women, men and companies in communications and technology.

Name: Chicago Women Developers
Description: Community for Chicago Women Developers

Name: Ms. Tech Group
Description: Creates experiences that inspire and accelerate both online and offline conversations, improving the representation and ultimately the success of women in business and technology.

Name: National Center for Women & Information Technology (NCWIT)
Description: National non-profit organization that works to increase the meaningful participation of girls and women in computing.

Name: Hackbright Academy
Description: Hackbright Academy is the leading engineering school for women in San Francisco.

Name: Code First: Girls
Description: Helps companies train their people, and develop their talent management policies and processes so they don’t miss out on amazing female tech talent.

Name: Railsbridge
Description: Focuses on increasing diversity in tech, so that people of all backgrounds can feel welcome and comfortable in our industry.

Name: she++
Description: she++ works to empower underrepresented groups in technology by dismantling negative stereotypes surrounding technical careers.

Name: Ada Developers Academy
Description: An intensive software development training program for women in Seattle.

Name: Grace Hopper Academy
Description: Grace Hopper Academy is an immersive software engineering school for women with no upfront tuition cost.

Name: Astia
Description: Astia’s model is designed to change the way our ecosystem looks at and evaluates high potential organizations, increasing the recognition of, and investment into women entrepreneurs and their teams.

Name: Women in Technology Inspirational
Description: WITI is the premier global organization helping tech-savvy women attain their professional goals.

Name: Computing Research Association - Women
Description: Increasing the success and participation of women in computiong research.

Name: The Coalition to Diversify Computing
Description: The Coalition to Diversify Computing (CDC) is a joint organization of the ACM and CRA.

Name: Center for Minorities and People with Disabilities in IT
Description: The center ensures that under-represented groups are fully engaged in computing and information technologies, and promotes innovation that enriches, enhances, and enables these communities, such that more equitable and sustainable contributions are possible by all communities.

Name: ACM-Women
Description: ACM-W supports, celebrates, and advocates internationally for the full engagement of women in all aspects of the computing field, providing a wide range of programs and services to ACM members and working in the larger community to advance the contributions of technical women.

Name: Women in Wireless
Description: The mission of Women in Wireless is to connect, inspire, and empower female leaders in the mobile and digital space.

Name: Anita Borg Istitute
Description: The institute’s primary aim is to recruit, retain, and advance women in technology.

Name: Tech Inclusion Community
Description: Tech Inclusion takes an ecosystem approach to improving diversity and inclusion in the tech industry.

Name: People of Color in Tech
Description: Highlights the current achievements of ‘people of color’ within the sphere of technology and startups, and to inspire the next generation.

Name: Good for POC
Description: Promotes companies that provide an inclusive and safe work environment for people of color in tech.

Name: Code for Progress
Description: Code for Progress cultivates a growing community of diverse professionals who have the technical skills and cultural competency to bring innovation to non-profits, government and industry.

Name: Code2040
Description: CODE2040 creates access, awareness, and opportunities for top Black and Latino/a engineering talent to ensure their leadership in the innovation economy.

Name: Girls Who Code
Description: National non-profit organization working to close the gender gap in technology.

Name: Women Who Code
Description: Non-profit organization dedicated to inspiring women to excel in technology careers.

Name: Women in Technology
Description: WIT utilizes its programs, connections, volunteer opportunities and events to enable the development of the WIT community through recognition, thought leadership and foundation efforts.

Name: Code Liberation
Description: The Code Liberation Foundation offers free development workshops in order to facilitate the creation of video game titles by women.

Name: Girls in Tech
Description: Global non-profit focused on the engagement, education and empowerment of girls and women who are passionate about technology.

Name: Code to Work
Description: Providing opportunities for Employers to find diverse sources of IT talent.

Name: Computing Alliance of Hispanic Serving Institutions
Description: The institution aims to increase the number of Hispanics who pursue and complete baccalaureate and advanced degrees in computing areas.

Name: Power to Fly
Description: PowerToFly connects companies to women in tech and across digital that work remotely.

Name: Women of Color in Tech Chat
Description: The goal of the organization is to connect women of color and non-binary people of color to career and skills-building opportunities in tech.

Name: Tech Ladies
Description: Connect women and tech companies.
